name: Rub23 - Akureyri's Sushi & Fusion Seafood Restaurant
description: Rub23 brings creative fusion cuisine to Akureyri, Iceland's northern capital, offering unique menu concept where diners select their preferred fish or meat and then choose from list of international spice rub mixtures—Asian, American, and traditional Icelandic preparations—that are rubbed into ingredients before cooking, creating personalized flavor combinations that distinguish Rub23 from conventional restaurants offering fixed preparations. The name references this innovative approach: "rub" has become common culinary term for mixed spices rubbed into proteins, and the restaurant's philosophy celebrates this technique by offering approximately 23 different variations (hence the number in the name) that allow customers to customize their dining experience. Located at Kaupvangsstræti 6 in central Akureyri, the restaurant operates year-round serving lunch Monday-Friday (11:30 AM-2:00 PM) and dinner daily (5:00-10:00 PM Sunday-Thursday, 5:00-11:00 PM Friday-Saturday), with Saturday being dinner-only. The extensive sushi menu represents significant addition to Akureyri's dining scene, bringing Japanese techniques and preparations to northern Iceland using local fish from Iceland's exceptionally clean fishing grounds—the combination of Japanese precision with Icelandic ingredient quality creates sushi that rivals metropolitan offerings despite Akureyri's population of only 20,000 and remote location 390 kilometers from Reykjavík.

opening_hours.unique_concept: Choose fish/meat, then select from ~23 international spice rub mixtures
opening_hours.name_meaning: Rub = spice mixtures rubbed into ingredients, 23 = approximately 23 variations
opening_hours.customization: Matrix of proteins and seasonings creates hundreds of combinations
opening_hours.sushi_program: Extensive sushi menu using local Icelandic fish with Japanese techniques
opening_hours.fusion_philosophy: Apply Asian and American ingenuity to Icelandic ingredients
opening_hours.seafood_source: Local Icelandic fishermen, North Atlantic waters
opening_hours.meat_source: Icelandic farmers, free-range lamb and beef
opening_hours.flavor_examples: Teriyaki Arctic char, wasabi-crusted cod, chimichurri lamb
opening_hours.repeat_appeal: Different combinations across multiple visits prevent menu exhaustion
opening_hours.group_dining: High customization accommodates diverse preferences at one table
opening_hours.clientele: Ring Road travelers + cruise ship passengers + locals
opening_hours.market_position: Metropolitan sophistication in region with limited dining competition
opening_hours.japanese_quality: Rivals metropolitan sushi despite remote northern location
opening_hours.ingredient_advantage: Exceptionally clean Icelandic fishing grounds produce premium fish
opening_hours.creative_freedom: Not bound by traditional Icelandic simplicity, embraces international flavors
opening_hours.year_round: Operates throughout the year, including dark winters
